title: How to Make Spicy Hot Chocolate

methods.name: Chili, cinnamon and red pepper hot chocolate

steps.headline: Put the chocolate in a mug and add a splash of the milk or milk substitute so that the chocolate is almost covered.
steps.description: Melt the chocolate in the microwave and stir until the consistency is creamy. This step can also be done on the stove in a pot.

steps.headline: Once the chocolate is a smooth consistency add the remainder of the milk and heat until warm.
steps.description: Add a teaspoon of vanilla extract.

steps.headline: Add a dash of salt and sweeten to taste.
steps.description: After this add the cinnamon, chili pepper and red pepper to taste. Feel free to experiment with quantities here, play with measurements until you find the combination that's right for you.

steps.headline: Stir well and serve warm.
Add all of the ingredients to a heavy based saucepan or pot.
Bring to a low boil.
Whisk as it cooks for 2 minutes.
Remove from the heat.
steps.description: Pour into the serving mug(s). Top with whipped cream as a garnish (optional).

steps.headline: Pour 2 quarts of water into the stock pot or large saucepan.
steps.description: Add the cinnamon sticks. Bring to the boil over high heat.

steps.headline: Add half of the masa to 1 US-quart (950 ml) of water in a blender.
steps.description: Fill about three quarters of the way. Blend to combine.

steps.headline: Add the remaining half of the masa.
Pour the masa liquid into the boiling cinnamon water.
steps.description: Do this in a slow and steady stream, not all at once. Stir to combine.

steps.headline: Break the Mexican chocolate tablets into small pieces.
Pop the broken chocolate pieces into the blender.
steps.description: Pour in the evaporated milk and condensed milk. Blend to combine well.

steps.headline: Gradually add the chocolate liquid to the boiling liquid.
Pour in the milk and stir.
Cook to a gentle boil.
Check the consistency of the hot chocolate as it cooks.
steps.description: If it is not thick enough, you can add a little more masa and stir well.

steps.headline: Check the taste.
steps.description: Add sugar if you consider it is needed.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat.
Pour into mugs.
steps.description: It can be served immediately. Alternatively, let it cool and refrigerate it for serving cold.

steps.headline: Finished.

text: Chili, cinnamon and red pepper hot chocolate Put the chocolate in a mug and add a splash of the milk or milk substitute so that the chocolate is almost covered. Melt the chocolate in the microwave and stir until the consistency is creamy. This step can also be done on the stove in a pot. Once the chocolate is a smooth consistency add the remainder of the milk and heat until warm. Add a teaspoon of vanilla extract. Add a dash of salt and sweeten to taste. After this add the cinnamon, chili pepper and red pepper to taste. Feel free to experiment with quantities here, play with measurements until you find the combination that's right for you. Stir well and serve warm.  Spicy maple hot chocolate Add all of the ingredients to a heavy based saucepan or pot.  Bring to a low boil. Then turn to a simmer. Whisk as it cooks for 2 minutes.  Remove from the heat. Pour into the serving mug(s). Top with whipped cream as a garnish (optional). Pour 2 quarts of water into the stock pot or large saucepan. Add the cinnamon sticks. Bring to the boil over high heat. Add half of the masa to 1 US-quart (950 ml) of water in a blender. Fill about three quarters of the way. Blend to combine. Add the remaining half of the masa. Blend again to combine. Pour the masa liquid into the boiling cinnamon water. Do this in a slow and steady stream, not all at once. Stir to combine. Break the Mexican chocolate tablets into small pieces.  Pop the broken chocolate pieces into the blender. Pour in the evaporated milk and condensed milk. Blend to combine well. Gradually add the chocolate liquid to the boiling liquid. Stir to combine. Pour in the milk and stir.  Cook to a gentle boil. Stir constantly. Check the consistency of the hot chocolate as it cooks. If it is not thick enough, you can add a little more masa and stir well. Check the taste. Add sugar if you consider it is needed. Remove from the heat. Strain out the cinnamon sticks. Pour into mugs. It can be served immediately. Alternatively, let it cool and refrigerate it for serving cold. Finished.
